About Section Text:
About Chandigarh University
Written By 
Collegedunia Team
 


Chandigarh University 
was established in 
2012 
in Mohali, Punjab. 
Chandigarh University
 is accredited with an
 “A+”
 Grade by NAAC and recognized by UGC & AICTE. It is also approved by ICAR, BCI, NCHMCT, PCI, COA, NCTE, AIU, and CSI. Chandigarh University is a member of IAU, ACU, IEEE, ASME, IUCEE and ACS. 
Chandigarh University's ranking
 is 
27th 
among all the Indian Universities by NIRF 2023. It is the first private university in India to earn 
ABET accreditation
 for the highest number of engineering programmes. 


Chandigarh University has 18 Institutes offering 
200+ courses
 in Management, Engineering, Journalism, and other fields in both regular and distance learning modes. 
Chandigarh University fees 
range from 
INR 1.35 Lakhs to INR 12.68 Lakhs
 for various courses offered at undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral levels. The 
popular courses
 of Chandigarh University are 
B.Tech, MBA, BBA, BCA, B.Com and M.Tech
.


Chandigarh University course admission
 is based on the entrance examination held by the university itself called 
Chandigarh University Common Entrance Test (
CUCET
).
 However, 
admission to Chandigarh University
 can also be taken based on merit in the national level examinations like CUET, JEE Mains, CAT, XAT, NATA, etc. Candidates scoring more than 
90% marks
 in the last qualifying examination are exempted from 
CUCET
. Additionally, the JEE Mains qualifiers having a rank up to 
50,000
 can apply for 
direct admission to Chandigarh University
 B.Tech courses. 


Chandigarh University Placements 
2023-24 is concluded with 
9,124
 placement offers. 
Chandigarh University’s highest package
 is
 INR 1.7 CPA
 offered by a US-based company to a B.Tech CSE-IBM Information Security student. The average package of Chandigarh University increased by 
16.14%
 in 2023 and stood at 
INR 9.54 LPA.


Chandigarh University campus
 is situated over an area of 
105.58 acres
 equipped with modern infrastructure and facilities. The university has a diverse crowd with over 
26,000 students
 from 50+ countries providing them with valuable social exposure.

Chandigarh University Courses & Fees


Chandigarh University offers over 
200 courses
 in various streams with the best ROI. The university also offers industry-oriented and professional courses in MBA and 
CSE
 programs. At the undergraduate level, Chandigarh University offers courses like B.Tech, B.Pharma, BBA, BCA, B.Com, BA, B.Sc., etc in different specializations. CUCHD also offers various PG programmes like MBA, MCA, M.Tech, MA, M.Com, M.Arch, etc. Chandigarh University encourages students to do research in various fields and thus offers Ph.D. courses in 
22 
specializations. 


The university also provides MBA in collaboration with industries like 
IBM, NSE Academy, SAS
, etc. Additionally, the university offers distance education through 
CUIDOL
 in courses like BBA, MBA, B.Com, M.Com, MA English, MA Psychology, etc. Chandigarh University offers 
19 online degree programs.

Chandigarh University Admission 2024


Chandigarh University course admission 
is held in two different phases namely CUCET-I and CUCET-II. Phase I is usually conducted from October to May followed by Phase II from May to October. 
Chandigarh University's admission process
 is conducted online and offline. The application fee of Chandigarh University is 
INR 1,000
 for undergraduate and postgraduate students. For Ph.D. applicants, the application fee is
 INR 1,100
. The candidates need to create their profiles on the CUCET portal for admission to the university.


To apply online for CUCET, candidates must register on the 
Chandigarh University official website
 @
https://www.cuchd.in/admissions/
 with the necessary details. The login credentials will be sent to the registered email and mobile number. After logging in, students must download the E-prospectus and fill out the application form available inside the prospectus to apply for admission. 


Students can also apply offline for 
admission
 by downloading the application form. The duly filled application form with a demand draft of INR 1000 must be sent to the following address: Admission Office, Chandigarh University, SCO 223, First Floor, Sector 36 D, Chandigarh - 160036. Post this, students can receive a prospectus from 
Chandigarh University Campus
 or the local Admission Office of the university.






CUCET 2024


Chandigarh University entrance exam
 (CUCET) is a National-level online entrance cum scholarship test conducted by the university. CUCET is mandatory for admission to Engineering, MBA, Pharmacy, LL.M., and Integrated Law Programs. Chandigarh University also provides scholarships based on CUCET scores. The duration of 
CUCET
 is 
2 Hours 
and it has 
100 MCQs.


The 
CUCET application form
 is available in both online and offline modes. Below are the steps for
 CUCET registration
:




Visit the CUCET official website @
cucet.cuchd.in
 
for registration and to create your profile.


You will receive a confirmation message through SMS/E-Mail after a successful registration. 


After registration, you need to pay a registration fee of INR 1000 which includes the digital copy of the prospectus.


Fill in the current qualification. Choose the CUCET exam date available in the dropdown.


Appear for the CUCET exam on the scheduled date and time through the official portal with registered login details.


The result will be intimated through E-mail and will also be displayed on the official portal in your login account. 








Chandigarh University Cutoff 2024 


According to the student’s experiences, the 
Chandigarh University cutoff
 is not very high and the applicant can easily crack the examination (CUCET) with enough preparation for domain subjects. The counsellors at the university also help students in the admission process. Chandigarh University's CUCET cutoff is 
30%
 for Phase I and Phase II.

Chandigarh University Campus  


Chandigarh University has a vibrant campus
 
and it provides ample opportunities to students for cultural exchange and education. The following facilities are available at Chandigarh University:




Excellent Research Infrastructure: 
Chandigarh University has established the Technology Business Incubator (TBI), Kalpana Chawla Centre for Research in Space Science & Technology, and various other
 State-of-the-art Research labs
, some of which are unique among Indian universities.


Libraries: 
Chandigarh University has 18 libraries situated in different academic blocks with a rich collection of more than
 110000+ books
, 
236433 e-books
, and 
35034 e-journals
. CU Library has an institutional membership with DELNET and the British Council Library. 


Multiple Labs: 
Chandigarh University has over 30+ labs that are 
industry-sponsored advanced research labs 
such as Microsoft, HPE, IBM, Redhat, and many more. Apart from this Chandigarh University also has a Civil Engineering Lab, Computer Lab, Electrical Lab, Electronics Lab, Film Lab, Mechanical Lab, etc.


Sports & Adventure: 
Chandigarh University has a dedicated sports department offering a plethora of opportunities to maintain a healthy and active lifestyle while pursuing academic goals. The university offers state-of-the-art sports facilities, mentoring by sports experts, and a chance to avail sports scholarships.

How to Reach Chandigarh University?


Chandigarh University is located on NH 5, Chandigarh Ludhiana Highway in the Mohali district of Punjab State. Students and parents can reach Chandigarh University through different modes of transportation including Bus, Train and Flight.

Chandigarh University Faculty 


Chandigarh University faculty
 is well-educated and experienced in their field of education. The university has launched an 
International Faculty Exchange Programme
 (IEFP) allowing students to interact with global faculty. The university invites famous personalities for guest lectures like APJ Abdul Kalam, the Dalai Lama, Muhammad Yunus, Wole Soyinka, etc. 


Chandigarh University has a student-faculty ratio of 
14:1
. The university has 
54.45% male faculty
 and 
45% female faculty
 among which there are 22% of international faculty members. Chandigarh University faculty comes from 23 states and 2 union territories. The university has 1,300+ Ph.D. degree holders and around 450+ faculty members are pursuing their Ph.D. The
 faculty
 has published 
10,000+ research 
in the latest journals.

Chandigarh University Collaborations 


Chandigarh University has collaborated with 
486 Global Universities from 95 countries
. The university also has several programs to enable students to visit the universities and gain valuable academic and social exposure. Some of those programs are mentioned below:




Higher Education Programs:
 Students can visit international universities for certificate/ diploma programs or pursue a master's degree in a decided field.


International Exposure Program (Summer/Winter): 
The university provides summer and winter school opportunities for its students. Students can have international exposure without disturbing their academic schedule. These courses are short-duration programs that last for 2-4 weeks. 


Volunteer Internship: 
This allows universities to visit the host countries and do a volunteer internship for a couple of weeks. The interns are recruited year-round on a semester basis.

Chandigarh University FAQs


Ques. Is 
Chandigarh University
 good for CSE?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University is one of the top institutions for pursuing a CSE degree. It has been ranked 38
th
 for Engineering according to NIRF Ranking 2023. Moreover, the highest package offered during Chandigarh University Placement 2023 was INR 54.75 Lakhs for the Engineering course only. 




Ques. What is the address of Chandigarh University?




Ans.
 Chandigarh University is located in Gharuan, at a distance of 27 Km from Chandigarh Railway Station. The official address of Chandigarh University is “NH-05, Ludhiana - Chandigarh State Hwy, Sahibzada Ajit Singh Nagar, Punjab 140413”.




Ques. Is Chandigarh University UGC approved?




Ans. 
Yes, Chandigarh University is approved by UGC and various other boards such as AICTE, BCI, NCHMCT, PCI, COA, NCTE, AIU, and CSI. 




Ques. Is Chandigarh University costly?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University is comparatively cheaper in comparison to the other top private universities in India. Apart from that, the university offers numerous merit scholarships to students which include huge concessions in the tuition fees.




Ques. Which course is Chandigarh University famous for?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University is famous for three major courses namely B.Tech, MBA, and BBA programmes. These three courses are the most popular courses with a huge number of applications every year.




Ques. Is Chandigarh University private or government?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University is a private university established in 2012 in Mohali, India. 




Ques. Are there international students at Chandigarh University?




Ans.
 Yes, Chandigarh University has international students from more than 50 countries studying at its campus. Chandigarh University has a very diverse crowd and a thriving campus culture which helps students become more culturally nuanced. 




Ques. What is the NAAC Grade of Chandigarh University?
 




Ans. 
Chandigarh University has been awarded the NAAC Grade of A+ with a CGPA of 3.28. It is the youngest university in India to be awarded an A+ grade in its first round of accreditations. 




Ques.
 Is there a scholarship program available at Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
Yes, Chandigarh University offers various scholarship programs to meritorious students worth INR 170 Crores every year. The scholarships are based on academic performance and are available for both undergraduate and postgraduate students. The main criterion for giving scholarships is through the CUCET Exam. 




Ques. What are the top courses at Chandigarh University? 




Ans. 
The main courses at Chandigarh University are its B.Tech and MBA programs. These courses see the highest number of applications (60%) as well as the highest salary packages ranging as high as INR 1.7 CPA. 




Ques. How to log in to the CUIMS account? 




Ans.
 Students can log in to the CUIMS account by entering the User ID provided by the University and the account password. Chandigarh University Information Management System (CUIMS) helps them keep track of their progress and know about the current happenings in the university. 




Ques. Is Chandigarh University good?




Ans.
 Chandigarh University is one of India’s fastest-growing universities in several domains. Chandigarh University has been ranked as the Number 1 Private University in India by QS World University Rankings 2024. The university provides its students with the finest quality of education, campus life, extracurriculars, accommodation, and placements. Chandigarh University has 18 departments and more than 20+ university-established centres of excellence. The hi-tech best-in-class facilities and academic excellence are what make Chandigarh University stand out. The student-to-teacher ratio at the university is 14:1, making it stand on par with other top universities in the country. With over 26,000 students, the university also offers separate hostels that can accommodate both boys and girls. Hostel residents can also enjoy all the facilities available on the hostel grounds.




Ques. Are Chandigarh University and Panjab University are same?




Ans. 
No Chandigarh University and Panjab University are different universities. Chandigarh University is a private university whereas Panjab University is a government university.




Ques. Can international students pay their fees in cash at Chandigarh University?




Ans.
 It is advised that all International students must pay their fees online through the Chandigarh University official website. The fee shall be paid through Swift Transfer using the Bank Fee Due Invoice and the Acceptance Letter will be sent at the time of admission. If students wish to pay the fee in cash, cash handling charges would be applicable.




Ques. What is the Global Fellowship Program at Chandigarh University? 




Ans. 
The Global Fellowship Program (GFP) is a multi-disciplinary two-year post-graduate degree program. It provides a diploma after the completion of one year. The program accepts applications from a graduate or postgraduate with a strong academic record, extracurricular achievement, and strong communication skills. Students in this program can also leave after the completion of one year and receive their post-graduate diploma in Liberal Arts and Humanities.


Candidates must send in their entries by filling out an application form with a Statement of Purpose (SOP) and must mention two references.




Ques. Does Chandigarh University offer semester exchange programs?




Ans.
 Yes, Chandigarh University has joined hands with a variety of universities from Europe, the Americas, and Australia to help its students secure semester exchange programs in those universities. The students are required to look up the universities they are interested in attending and fill in the necessary details for the same.




Ques. Who is exempted from Chandigarh University’s CUCET Exam?




Ans.
 Students who score more than 90% in the qualifying exams or have less than 50000 Rank in the JEE Mains exam are exempted from CUCET. Students who have a valid score in other national level exams such as NATA, CAT, etc. are also exempted from taking the CUCET Exam. 




Ques. Is the degree from Chandigarh University internationally recognized?
 




Ans. 
Chandigarh University is a member of many national and international bodies such as AoU, WUS, AICTE, etc. and its degrees are recognized by all the premier universities abroad. 




Ques. How many departments are under Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
There are a total of 18 institutes/departments under Chandigarh University that provide specialized courses in disciplines ranging from Engineering, Medical, Commerce, etc. 




Ques. What is the highest package offered by Chandigarh University? 




Ans. 
Chandigarh University has a robust placement cell that helps students get the best placements possible. This is reflected in the placement numbers as the highest salary offered by Chandigarh University stood at INR 1.7 CPA (International) and INR 54.75 LPA (domestic) for the placement year 2023-24. 




Ques. Who are the top recruiters at Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
Amazon, Deloitte, IBM, EY, Microsoft, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Qualcomm, and Marvel are some of the top recruiters at Chandigarh University Placements.




Ques. What is the minimum attendance required at Chandigarh University? 




Ans. 
Chandigarh University has a strict attendance policy and students require a minimum of 75% attendance for students to be able to sit in the exams. 




Ques. Is there any entrance exam for Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University Common Entrance Test (CUCET) is a university-level entrance cum scholarship test conducted by Chandigarh University for admission to various undergraduate and postgraduate programs. CUCET is an online computer-based test conducted twice every year in two phases. The duration of the CUCET exam is 2 Hours and carries a total of 100 Marks. CUCET 2024 Phase I is ongoing. Interested candidates can appear for the Chandigarh University Entrance Test by paying an application fee of INR 1,000.




Ques. What are the criteria to apply for Chandigarh University study abroad programs?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University has global tie-ups with 65+ countries. The university offers study-abroad programs in countries like Canada, the USA, Australia, New Zealand, France, and Europe. The student must have scored a minimum of 6 CGPA with no backlogs and an IELTS score of 6.5 bands to apply for the Chandigarh University study abroad programs.




Ques. What are the approvals of Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University is approved by ICAR, BCI, NCHMCT, PCI, COA, NCTE, AIU, CSI, and other prominent bodies. The institute holds the membership of international organizations like, IAU, ACU, IEEE, ASME, IUCEE, and ACS.




Ques. Is there any direct admission policy at Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University offers direct admission to students securing more than 90% in the previous qualifying examination. Students who have qualified for national level examinations like NATA, JEE Mains, CAT, MAT, UGC NET, etc are exempted from the Chandigarh University entrance exam and eligible for direct admission.




Ques. How much percentage is required for Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
The applicant must have a minimum of 50% marks in the previous qualifying examination to be eligible for the preliminary screening at Chandigarh University.




Ques. What are the placement scenarios for B.Pharm students at Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
As per the latest data available on the official website, 27 pharmaceutical companies visited the Chandigarh University campus to hire B.Pharma students. The highest package for B.Pharma is INR 4.38 LPA at Chandigarh University. Some of the top recruiters of B.Pharma at Chandigarh University are Roots Analysis, OMICS International, WNS Global Services, GMH Organics, Apollo Hospitals Enterprises Ltd., Health Biotech, etc. 159 students were selected by the recruiters.




Ques. What placement opportunities are available for B.Sc. students at Chandigarh University?




Ans. 
Chandigarh University's median package for B.Sc. is INR 2.70 LPA. The Department of Physics at Chandigarh University saw a participation of 40+ companies. 


The highest domestic package for B.Sc. (Physics) at Chandigarh University is INR 15 LPA. The top recruiters of Chandigarh University for B.Sc. students are Wipro, Zomato, Adani Solar, Zifo RnD Solutions, Unext Learning Pvt Ltd, etc.


The highest package for Science students at Chandigarh University stood at INR 36 LPA offered to a M.Sc. Physics student at Mohawk College, Canada.
